results.content: I am understanding most of it but it gets a little hard to understand when functions and methods using different languages are used, we started with html then moved to xml, jquery, and now ajax all in one api document. I feel it would have been easier to stick to one language especially since I am not proficient at each of the languages used. Right  now it feels like I will need four or five cheat sheets on my desk one for each language used in the document plus a page to remind me of syntax. But I am still able to follow along, I don't think I could build one on my own yet. This is my first course on how to build api's I'll add so your mileage may vary.

results.content:
Nice course since using APIs is fundamental nowadays.
This course is also basic for any frontend.
You won't have the way to use APIs in React or Angular but you will have the way to use it via Vanilla Javascript and JQuery which are the fundamentals in how to use APIs for javascript/typescript frameworks.

results.content: Course becomes more interesting once getting into the app dev. However, could use more detail around why we're writing what we write. Grated it is mostly HTML, so it is understandable why we wouldn't go too in depth with it. Overall pretty good.
